intro: Licania glazioviana, commonly known as the Glaziovian licania, is a species of flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a landscape plant.
